intro: Staudtia kamerunensis var. gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon staudtia, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
